author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
nhc_headline: ...RAYMOND BECOMES A REMNANT LOW AND THIS IS THE LAST NHC ADVISORY... ...REMNANT MOISTURE TO BRING A RISK OF FLASH FLOODING TO NORTHWESTERN MEXICO AND SOUTHWESTERN UNITED STATES FOR ANOTHER FEW DAYS...
summary: ...RAYMOND BECOMES A REMNANT LOW AND THIS IS THE LAST NHC ADVISORY... ...REMNANT MOISTURE TO BRING A RISK OF FLASH FLOODING TO NORTHWESTERN MEXICO AND SOUTHWESTERN UNITED STATES FOR ANOTHER FEW DAYS... As of 8:00 PM MST Sat Oct 11 the center of Raymond was located near 22.9, -110.0 with movement NNW at 9 mph. The minimum central pressure was 1005 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 30 mph.

As of 8:00 PM MST Sat Oct 11 the center of Raymond was located near 22.9, -110.0 with movement NNW at 9 mph. The minimum central pressure was 1005 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 30 mph.

title: Summary - Post-Tropical Cyclone Raymond (EP2/EP172025)
